metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10217 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in ansible 2.8.0 before 2.8.4. Fields managing sensitive data should be set as such by no_log feature. Some of these fields in GCP modules are not set properly. service_account_contents() which is common class for all gcp modules is not setting no_log to True. Any sensitive data managed by that function would be leak as an output when running ansible playbooks.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10217` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible - 2.8.6+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ansible package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.8.6+dfsg-1').
